results.title: Block printing
results.creator_credit: Arthur Browning, Edward T. Hall and Garrison Films
results.brief_description: Shows first a few examples of block printing of fabrics and then demonstrates how the block is made. Displays the tools needed and their uses.

results.title: Blinkity blank
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film experiment by Norman McLaren in the use of intermittent animation and spasmodic imagery. McLaren makes play with the laws relating to persistence of vision and after image on the retina of the eye. By engraving non-representational visuals directly on black, emulsion-coated films in interrupted sequence, he achieves a ‘Now you see it, now you don’t effect. The music background is in the form of semi-free instrumental improvisation, with percussive effects added by synthetic sounds scratched directly on film. (Awards: London, Cannes, Edinburgh, Berlin, Los Angeles)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Blindness
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a man who lost his sight during the best years of his life. Filmed with the help of the Canadian National Institute for the Blind, this study of blindness tries to show the emotional effect of the sudden loss of sight and how a man so stricken climbs back from the brink of despair. How he learns a trade which enables him to support himself and eventually a family, is a story of quiet triumph convincingly portrayed. Starring Len Cariou
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Blind teacher in a public school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Ticchi, Henry Felt and Graduate School of Education, Harvard University
results.brief_description: Shows how one blind man, David Ticchi, carries out his daily responsibilities as a full-time teacher of English. He is seen performing normal tasks required of a classroom teacher, and when interviewed, he explains his teaching methods. Explores the peculiar advantages a blind teacher may bring to a sighted classroom. Includes interviews with David Ticchi’s students and colleagues.

results.title: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center
results.brief_description: Follows a blind and a sighted child through the sensori-motor period during the first year of life in an attempt to answer the following questions. How is this crucial period affected when one of the major senses is lacking? What are the pathways of progress for the blind infant? What are the limits set by his handicap?

results.creator_credit_for_label: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center

results.title: BLEVE = Boiling liquid expansion vapourised explosion
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Rosenblum, National Fire Protection Association (U.S.) and Urban Image
results.brief_description: A fire safety and fire-fighting film about BLEVE - “Boiling Liquid Expansion Vapourised Explosion.” Includes several American newsclips dealing with large liquid petroleum gas cylinder fires.

results.title: Bleeding: what to do
results.creator_credit: Yehuda Tarmu, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: In the critical minutes before professional help arrives, what is done can mean the difference between life and death. The film shows how to stop the bleeding at once. Animation models and re-enactments are used to illustrate the physiology, main pressure points and effective first aid techniques. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yehuda Tarmu, David Adams and Pyramid Films

results.title: Blast furnace
results.brief_description: Elementary treatment illustrating processes by which iron ore is smelted in a blast furnace to produce cast iron. The following aspects are covered: layout of furnace, pre-heating and other plant; raw materials used and method of charging furnace; operation of furnace; tapping of slag and molten metal; sealing tap holes; castings of molten metal into pigs.

results.title: Blast
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1914, Ezra Pound, Wyndham Lewis, Gaudier-Brska and others published “Blast”, the manifesto of the Vorticist movement. Their aim was to disrupt the Edwardian conventions of the Royal Academy and to introduce an alternative artistic vocabulary. The film gives an account of the activities of the Vorticists. Script by Richard Cork, photography by David Peat, music by Ron Geesin.

results.title: Blackwood
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Richly woven of fine threads that mingle and separate, surface and disappear, this poetic documentary studies the works of one of Canada’s greatest contemporary etchers: Newfoundland-born David Blackwood. The artist himself guides the viewer through a step-by-step explanation of the entire etching process. Scenes of his hometown, examples of his masterfully crafted prints, and the vivid tales of an old mariner recall the tragic seal hunts and a way of life that has now vanished. (Awards: Yorkton, Brussels, Paris)
